subject: physics
title: Kinetic Model of Matter MCQ Problems

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: According to the kinetic model, what causes gas pressure in a container?
options: Collisions of particles with container walls
problems.detailed: Gas pressure arises from particles colliding with the walls of the container; more frequent or stronger collisions increase pressure.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In which state of matter do particles have fixed positions but vibrate in place?
problems.hint: Think of a rigid block of ice.
problems.detailed: In a solid, particles are closely packed in a fixed, regular arrangement and vibrate about their fixed positions.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What happens to the average kinetic energy of gas particles when temperature increases?
problems.hint: Temperature is a measure of kinetic energy.
problems.detailed: As temperature increases, the average kinetic energy of gas particles also increases, leading to faster and more energetic motion.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which assumption applies to ideal gases according to the kinetic model?
problems.hint: Ideal gas means no attraction or repulsion.
problems.detailed: In the kinetic model for ideal gases, intermolecular forces are negligible; particles move independently except during elastic collisions.

problems.detailed: Brownian motion, observed as the random movement of particles like pollen in a fluid, provides evidence for the constant, random motion of tiny particles.
